error.description: The details of an error that has occurred

httpStatusCode.description: The http status code (4xx and 5xx HTTP status codes)

errorDetail.example: Oops! An error has occurred: ScriptExecutionFailed

example.errorDetail: Oops! An error has occurred: ScriptExecutionFailed

recordCount.description: The number of records returned in the result set

totalRecords.description: The number of records in total in the full query set

metaChallenge.description: Meta Object containing responses to a step up challenges

items.description: The response to a step up challenge (e.g. credit card step up or gift card passcode)

instrumentId.description: The instrument id related to the step up challenge

type.description: The type of token that has been provided

token.description: The value requested by the challenge

reference.description: An optional reference that could be used for audit tracing

preferencesCustomer.description: Available preference settings for a customer

primaryInstrumentId.description: The primary instrument that will be used by default for a payment if a specific instrument is not specified.  The primary instrument will be used for the balance of the payment after any specified secondary instruments are used first.

secondaryInstruments.description: Rules for the creation of a default set of secondary instruments to be used for a payment if a specific set is not specified.  Secondary instruments are used in order until the full amount of the payment has been paid.

enableSecondaryInstruments.description: Flag indicating whether secondary instruments are enabled or disabled.  If not present defaults to enabled.  Used to specifically disable secondary instruments without losing customer configure preferences.

order.description: The order that the secondary instruments will be used for a specific payment.

exclude.description: Array of instruments to exclude from the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

include.description: Array of instruments to specifically include in the secondary instruments set.  Indicates that the set of secondary instruments should start as empty and only include all valid instruments excluding those in this list.

preferenceGroup.description: A set of groups of key/value based preferences

additionalProperties.description: A group or category of preferences

qrId.description: The ID of the QR code

referenceId.description: The ID of the payment request linked to this QR code

referenceType.description: The type of ID held in referenceId

content.description: The text content for the QR code.  The template used in creating this value can be overriden using merchant preferences.

image.description: Base64 encoded PNG of the QR Code

expiryTime.description: ISO date/time string indicating when the QR code will expire and become ineffective.  If absent then the QR code will not expire until it is deleted

basket.description: Information provided by the Merchant on the basket of items associated with the payment request.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions

items.description: An array of items in the basket

label.description: Short label for the basket item

description.description: Longer description of the basket item

quantity.description: The number of units of the item in the basket if multiple is possible.  Is a number to accommodate items charged by weight or length

unitPrice.description: The unit price of the item.  May be positive or negative

unitMeasure.description: Optional display string for the measure of the unit

totalPrice.description: The total price of the item.  May be positive or negative

tags.description: Additional string/string key/value pairs for the item defined by the merchant

posPayload.description: Payload describing the specific POS system.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

merchantPayload.description: Payload provided by the merchant to support other types of messaging.  This payload originates in the payment request and is carried with any resulting transactions.  Provided in a generic schema previous configured by the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of this payment request

merchantReferenceId.description: The unique reference for the payment as defined by the Merchant

grossAmount.description: The gross amount to be paid.  Must be positive except for refunds

merchantPaymentSummary.description: Summary information for a single payment request

usesRemaining.description: The number of times that the payment request can be used to create a payment. If absent then request can be used an unlimited number of times

expiryTime.description: The ISO date/time for when the payment request will expire and become unusable for payments.  If absent then the payment request will not expire until it is deleted

specificWalletId.description: The ID of a specific wallet for which the payment is intended.  If present then the payment can only be used by the intended wallet.  If absent then any wallet can create a payment against the payment request

customerPaymentRequestDetails.description: Detailed information for a single payment request

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant associated with this transaction

merchantPaymentDetails.description: Detailed information for a single payment request

clientReference.description: An optional client reference associated with the transaction.  If not supplied the transactionId will be used.

type.description: The type of transaction: PAYMENT or REFUND

executionTime.description: Date/time stamp of when the transaction occurred in ISO string format

status.description: The current status of the transactions

statusDetail.description: The error detail returned by downstream processes when the payment is REJECTED

refundReason.description: The reason provided for the refund.  Only provided for REFUND transactions

customerTransactionSummary.description: Summary information of the resulting transaction

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant associated with this transaction

instruments.description: The instruments used to make the payment.  For refunds and cash back amounts will be negative

items.description: An instrument used for this transaction

paymentInstrumentId.description: The ID of the payment instrument

amount.description: The amount charged against or refunded to this instrument

merchantTransactionSummary.description: Summary information of the resulting transaction

walletId.description: The ID of the wallet associated with this transaction

customerTransactionDetail.description: Detailed information for a single transaction

merchantTransactionDetail.description: Detailed information for a single transaction

schemaId.description: The unique ID assigned to the newly created schema

type.description: The type of the schema e.g. pos, merchant

created.description: The ISO date/time when the schema was created

paymentSessionId.description: The ID of the payment session

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of the associated payment request

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant initiating the payment session

walletId.description: The ID of the customers wallet

expiryTime.description: The ISO date/time for when the payment session will expire and become unusable

location.description: The location of the payment session (Used to group payment sessions)

merchantInfo.description: Payload used to pass merchant information to the customer

customerInfo.description: Payload used to pass customer information back to the merchant

schemaId.description: The ID of the previously configured schema that will be used to validate the contents of the payload

payload.description: The payload aligned to the supplied schema

paymentInstrumentId.description: The credit card payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The credit card payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

expiryYear.description: The year of the expiry date of the credit card.

expiryMonth.description: The month of the expiry date of the credit card.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the credit card number.

cvvValidated.description: A flag to indicate if the CVV of the credit card has been validated.

cardName.description: The nickname of the credit card instrument in the container.

expired.description: A flag to indicate if the credit card is expired.

requiresCVV.description: A flag to indicate if payments with this credit card requires a CVV check.

updateURL.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For credit cards this will be CAPTURE_CVV which identifies that the consumer must capture the CVV prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

url.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card expiry and CVV or CVV only. The URL will automatically switch between expiry and CVV or CVV only endpoints based on the container requirement.

paymentInstrumentId.description: The gift card payment instrument id.

paymentToken.description: The gift card payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the gift card number.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For gift cards this will be REQUIRE_PASSCODE which identifies that the consumer must capture the PIN prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

contentTypeParam.name: content-type
contentTypeParam.description: The MIME type of the body of the request.

apiKeyParam.name: x-api-key
apiKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the API key, if this endpoint is being called directly from a web browser based site/page using client side code (eg. via javascript using AJAX).

authKeyParam.name: a-auth-key
authKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the base64 encoded API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server.

authDigestParam.name: x-auth-digest
authDigestParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the encrypted API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server. The API key is encrypted with the client secret key.

messageIdParam.name: x-message-id
messageIdParam.description: This id is used to keep track of the request and its response in the Digital Pay platform. If no value is provided for the request header, Apigee will auto generate an id to use for the request. This header will also be returned in the response and will have the value passed in OR generated for the request.

authorizationParam.name: authorization
authorizationParam.description: The access token is obtained from the auth/login endpoint after a user is authenticated. This token is a bearer token.

versionParam.name: x-v
versionParam.description: The version of the end point requested for this invocation.

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of the new payment request

everydayPay.description: A list of payment instruments stored in the customers everydayPay wallet

paymentToken.description: The payment token. The payment token is a unique identifier for the payment instrument.

paymentInstrumentType.description: The type of the payment instrument.

status.description: The status of the payment instrument in the container.

createdOn.description: The timestamp for when the payment instrument was added. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUpdated.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last updated in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601.

lastUsed.description: The timestamp the payment instrument was last used in the container. The timestamp format is ISO8601. Will be null if never used.

primary.description: A flag to indicate if this payment instrument is the primary instrument in the container.

allowed.description: A flag to indicate if the merchant profile in the container allows the use of this payment instrument.

cardSuffix.description: The suffix (last 4 digits) of the gift card number.

type.description: The type of the step up action. For gift cards this will be REQUIRE_PASSCODE which identifies that the consumer must capture the PIN prior to payment.

mandatory.description: A flag to indicate if this step up (action) is mandatory.

cardCaptureURL.description: The URL of an iframe. This iframe is used to capture a credit card number, expiry and CVV

transactionRef.description: Container reference in the transaction logs. This number uniquely identifies the transaction in the container

transactions.description: The resulting list of transactions.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

payments.description: The resulting list of payments.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

schemas.description: A list of IDs for the currently valid schemas for this merchant
Schema to capture the point of sale information
Schema to capture the point of sale information
Schema to capture the point of sale information

data.description: Schema to capture information about the sale

paymentSessionId.description: The ID of the new payment session

type.description: The type of the schema e.g. pos, mewrchant

schema.description: The schema content formatted according to JSON Schema standards

created.description: The ISO date/time when the schema was created

data.description: Schema to capture the point of sale information

transactions.description: The resulting list of transactions.  If no results match the request then an empty array will be returned

get.description: Get the list of payment instruments currently configured for the customer.  Returns an array of instrument records that can be used to execute payments

post.description: Initiate the addition of a new payment instrument for this customer.  This API returns a URL to be used to access the DigiPay IFrame based interface to request the customer to enter a payment instrument details.

get.description: Get the specified payment instrument of the customer. Returns the payment instrument data and optionally the sensitive data (encrypted in the response) of an instrument record

parameters.name: paymentInstrumentId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific instrument

parameters.name: publicKey
parameters.description: The optional ephemeral public key used to encrypt sensitive instrument data and include ('cipherText' in the 'meta' object) that encrypted data in the response sent back to the consumer. If this parameter is omitted the sensitive data is NOT returned in the response to the consumer.

parameters.name: paymentInstrumentId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific instrument

parameters.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the base64 encoded API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server.

parameters.name: X-Auth-Digest
parameters.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the encrypted API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server. The API key is encrypted with the client secret key.

parameters.name: X-Message-Id
parameters.description: This id is used to keep track of the request and its response in the Digital Pay platform. If no value is provided for the request header, Apigee will auto generate an id to use for the request. This header will also be returned in the response and will have the value passed in OR generated for the request.

post.description: Perform charge transaction against a payment agreement. This service will use the provided information to perform the charge transaction. A charge payment is made by the merchant to charge a customer as per their payment agreement. This API is IP restricted to allow unauthenticated server side calls.

get.description: Get a list of the previously executed transactions with the merchant.  Note that amounts are relative to the merchant.  A positive amount is a positive amount transferred to a merchant

parameters.name: start-time
parameters.description: If present, the date/time to limit transactions returned.  Transactions older than this time will not be returned

parameters.name: end-time
parameters.description: If present, the date/time to limit transactions returned.  Transactions newer than this time will not be returned

parameters.name: page-size
parameters.description: The number of records to return for this page.  Defaults to 25 if absent

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return with 1 indicating the first page.  Defaults to 1 if absent

post.description: Refund payments. This API is IP restricted to allow unauthenticated server side calls.
Refund a previously executed transaction

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific transaction to reverse

requestBody.description: Request payload containing the refund reason and instructions

reason.description: The reason for the refund, or other message logged with the transaction

clientReference.description: An optional client reference to be associated with the transaction.  If not suplied the transactionId will be used.

422.description: The transaction specified doesn't exist or is a refund transaction already
